Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial cationic peptide derivatives of bactenecin.
Patent Information.Abstract: A novel class of cationic peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Exemplary peptides of the invention include RLARIVVIRVAR (SEQ ID NO:2) and RLSRIVVIRVCR (SEQ ID NO:3). Also provided are methods for inhibiting the growth of bacteria utilizing the peptides of the invention.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli K-12 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa K799 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium 14028s (MIC=2 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis C621 (MIC=1 µg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Listeria monocytogenes (MIC=0.25 µg/ml), Corynebacterium xerosis (MIC=0.25 µg/ml), Streptococcus pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC=1 µg/ml), S. mitis (MIC=0.25 µg/ml), Streptococcus pneumoniae ATCC 49619 (MIC=8 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Has antibacterial activiy against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Improved derivatives of bactenecin, a cyclic dodecameric antimicrobial cationic peptide.
Literature.Author: Wu M, Hancock RE.
